metadata.titel_preek: Der Glaube arbeitet an der Angst

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of human anxiety into productive energy for peace and justice through the 'work' of faith.

subject.identificatie: The Human Being / The Hearer (as 'Worker' of faith)
tekstueel_bewijs: Der Glaube arbeitet an der Angst
Wir können sie [die Angst] aber... bearbeiten
wir können aus dem Gefängnis einen Versammlungsraum machen
ein produktives Instrument, ein Instrument des Friedens und der Gerechtigkeit machen

zender.identificatie: Social/Psychological Ideal (The 'Vision' of a new world)
tekstueel_bewijs: wegen der größeren Vision auch die größere Angst benutzen

ontvanger.identificatie: The Oppressed / The World / The Self
tekstueel_bewijs: sich gründlicher auf die Unterdrückten und die Ausgebeuteten in der ganzen Welt einzulassen
Jesus ist nicht unser Herr, sondern unser Bruder und unser Freund
Die wirkliche Verwandlung... geschieht in Gruppen
helper.rol_van_god: God is a passive 'Stromkreis' (circuit) or background presence; Jesus is a fellow-sufferer/helper.

tekstueel_bewijs: unser Schiff ist nahe am Kentern
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: While described as 'cosmic' or 'social', the opponent is treated as a psychological energy that can be 'reworked' by the subject.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Stromkreis der Liebe' (Circuit of Love) where God assures the human they are not alone.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (human working on fear) overshadows the secondary program (God's presence). God provides the 'energy' but the human does the 'forging'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Vision of Justice → Transformation → The Oppressed

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott sagt uns, du bist nicht allein
voorbeelden_mens_subject: wir können die Energie unserer Ängste... gebrauchen

voorbeelden: Wir können sie [die Angst] aber... bearbeiten

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Knowing How' (Savoir-faire). Faith is presented as a technique or a psychological process that the subject must learn to master.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Anxiety) to ~S1 (Repression) to S1 (Working on fear).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through 'Umgestaltung' (transformation) – turning the energy of S2 into the work of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate. Anxiety is a 'resource' rather than a terminal condition requiring a Savior.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the use of 'Jesus' and 'God', the sermon is structurally anthropocentric. Faith is defined as a human activity ('arbeiten') and Jesus is reduced to a 'Brother' who provides a model for handling anxiety rather than a Lord who delivers from it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Der Glaube arbeitet an der Angst
Gott... will uns an diesen Stromkreis der Liebe anschließen

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the 'Brother' who shows how to sweat and cry, serving as a psychological archetype for the hearer.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jesus (as the one who sweats and cries)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus as the Lord of Nature and Death who speaks 'Peace, be still' into a chaos the disciples cannot 'work' on.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; faith becomes another task on the to-do list.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human provides the 'work' and God provides the 'electricity'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically fragmented, as it tries to bridge psychoanalysis and social activism without a strong Christological center.
spanning_punten: Jesus as 'Brother' vs. Jesus overcoming the world

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus speaks to us... so that we can one day say... we have overcome.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'separation' caused by profit and aggression, solvable through 're-tooling' energy.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a psychological/political manifesto where the human is the Subject and Faith is the Verb. God is relegated to a Helper/Object role.

subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ works on the human who is paralyzed by fear.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Nicht unser Glaube arbeitet an der Angst, sondern Christus arbeitet an uns, wenn wir vor Angst gelähmt sind.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Blacksmith' of their own soul.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'Silence!' of Jesus as a sovereign act of creation rather than a psychological process.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the Spirit giving the power to believe where the human 'cannot'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Anxiety as a symptom of the 'Chaos' that only the Creator can subdue.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a 'Heavy Opponent', the Savior becomes a mere 'Coach'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Program 2) is the only real story.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ stills the storm (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, we can walk on water/serve (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has strong social relevance but risks exhausting the hearer by turning faith into a psychological labor. Reclaiming the 'Lordship' of Christ over the 'Brotherhood' of Jesus would provide the grace needed to actually fuel the social action desired.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and empathetic. Actantially, it is a 'Law' sermon because the Subject is 'We'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note the 'Divine Authority' (Exousia) in the text; the sermon replaces this with 'Group Dynamics'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Faith' is functioning as a 'Tool' (Instrument) rather than a 'Relationship' (Transmission).

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 1970s/80s 'Political Theology' where the Actantial Subject is shifted to the collective 'We' to empower social change, often at the expense of theocentric grace.
